main event: On 15 November 1956, two nickel-sized white objects were observed in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.
interesting points: The objects appeared at the horizon and then disappeared instantaneously as if a light was switched off., One object was slightly below and smaller than the other., The sighting lasted for about 60 minutes and took place at 0750 GMT., The witness described the light as the most intense white light she had ever seen., Venus and Jupiter were ruled out as they would be visible in the east sky and disappear with the sunrise.
sighted object: two objects the size of a nickel, white in color
